metadata.title: CVE-2022-2905 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An out-of-bounds memory read flaw was found in the Linux kernel's BPFsubsystem in how a user calls the bpf_tail_call function with a key largerthan the max_entries of the map. This flaw allows a local user to gainunauthorized access to data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2905` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1083-fips - 4.4.0-1083.90
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1083-fips - 4.4.0-1083.90
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1083-fips - 4.4.0-1083.90
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1083-fips - 4.4.0-1083.90
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
